title: For CS Education...
body: I am a CS Professor. When I teach networking and also the operating systems course, I have students install Linux VMs.

comments.body: I saw some videos where Microsoft showed that this is possible, but what I am wondering can anyone point to me the extensions I would need to make this work? Where I can be able to run my code, to make linux binaries possible. Is it already built into Visual studio or do I need to download certain extensions to make this possible just wondering. Any links, anyone can offer would be greatly appreciated.
This is possible today. See this blog post for details: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vcblog/2017/04/11/linux-development-with-c-in-visual-studio/

"Bash tool for Visual Studio" is my dream tool. Some packages such as TensorFlow do not support for win-86 or win-64. If we could have "Bash tool for Visual Studio" to develop and debug by VS, it would be an amazing world!!

zgchen886@msn.com
This is not the right tool for teaching.  For teaching, use a real full Linux kernel not this.  You can inspect into the real Linux system in ways you will never be able to inspect or modify windows.
